name: Rui Zhang 0007
content: Rui Zhang@University of Delaware Rui Zhang Associate Professor Office: 100 S Main St, Suite 109, Rm 108 Computer and Information Sciences Department Phone: 302-831-2010 University of Delaware Fax: 302-831-8458 Newark, DE 19716 Email: I am always looking for highly self-motivated Ph.D. students who are strongly committed to research. If you are interested, please send your resume or CV, transcripts, TOEFL and GRE scores, and everything else that you believe will help your application to me in one email. Visiting scholars and students are also welcome. Biography Rui Zhang received his Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from the Arizona State University in 2013. He received the B.E. degree in Communication Engineering and the M.E. degree in Communication and Information Systems both from Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China, in 2001 and 2005, respectively. He was an assistant professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering at the University of Hawaii from 2013 to 2016 and a software engineer at UTStarcom, Shenzhen, from 2005 to 2007. He received the NSF CAREER Award in 2017. What's New May 2021 Congratulations to Yidan for successfully defending her Ph.D. dissertation, who will join the Department of Computing Security at Rochest Institute of Technology as a Tenure-Track Assistant Professor. Sept. 2019 I received an NSF grant on "Trustworthy Hierarchical Edge Computing". Aug. 2017 I received an NSF grant on "Secure Mobile Cloud Sensing". Jan. 2017 I received an NSF CAREER Award. Jan. 2016 I was invited to serve on the editorial board of IEEE Internet of Things Journal. Oct. 2015 Prof. Masahiro Mambo and I will organize ISC 2016. Please submit your good work and consider attending. Aug. 2015 I received an NSF grant on "Secure and usable indoor navigation for indivuals with visual impairment". Aug. 2014 I received an NSF grant on "Secure and usable authentication for people with visual impairment". Teaching CISC320 Introduction to Algorithms: Fall'21 CISC621 Algorithm Design and Analysis: Fall'20|Fall'19 CISC450/CPEG419 Computer Networks I: Spring'20|Spring'19|Fall'17 CISC464/664 Introduction to Network Security: Spring'19|Spring'18|Fall'16 CISC859 Advanced Topics in Communications, Distributed Computing Networks: Network Security: Fall'18|Spring'17 EE 205 Object Oriented Programming: Spring'16|Spring'15|Spring'14 (at University of Hawaii) EE 602 Algorithm I: Fall'15|Fall'14|Fall'13 (at University of Hawaii) Research Interests Security and privacy issus in wireless networks, mobile crowdsourcing, mobile systems for disabled people, cloud computing, and social networks Research Projects "SaTC: CORE: Small: Collaborative: Trustworthy Hierarchical Edge Computing," $250,000, National Science Foundation (CNS-1933047), 11/1/2019-10/1/2022, PI "SaTC: CORE: Small: Secure Mobile Cloud Sensing," $500,000, National Science Foundation (CNS-1718078), 9/1/2017-8/31/2020, PI "CAREER: Secure Database-Driven Dynamic Spectrum Sharing", $500,000, National Science Foundation (CNS-1651954), 5/1/2017-4/30/2022, PI "NeTS: Medium: Collaborative Research: Secure and Usable Indoor Navigation for Individuals with Visual Impairement," $250,000, National Science Foundation (CNS-1700039), 9/1/2015-8/31/2019, PI "TWC: Small: Collaborative: Secure and Usable Mobile Authentication for People with Visual Impairment," $149,999, National Science Foundation (CNS-1700032), 8/1/2015-7/31/2018, PI.
